Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: the beginning consists of an adult Miyazawa who has died and finds his past tormentor, Miura Shokichi. This part is a poetic illustration of a very well-known fairytale-esque style that was established by him.

Love it because it is all true!

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, Simon, is being chased by the townspeople because he has brought bad luck to them. Nobody hates Simon as much as the mother and son because Simon murdered the other members of their family because Katharine Peasenhall believed they were witches.
